plugin.name: Cassandra
plugin.description: Monitor and manage a Cassandra node. This plugin is currently being developed against the 1.1.x code base of Cassandra which comes from the cassandra-1.1 branch of the Cassandra git repo. The plugin will not yet work with 1.2.x Cassandra builds which come out of its trunk (i.e., master) branch.

c:simple-property.name: connectorAddress
c:simple-property.description: The RMI URL with which to connect to the Cassandra node (e.g. service:jmx:rmi:///jndi/rmi://localhost:7199/jmxrmi).

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The type used to establish the EMS connection to the Cassandra node.

c:simple-property.name: baseDir
c:simple-property.description: The base directory from which the Cassandra Daemon was launched.

c:simple-property.name: nativeTransportPort
c:simple-property.description: The port on which Cassandra listens for CQL client connections.

c:simple-property.name: host
c:simple-property.description: The host on which cassandra listens to CQL client connections

c:simple-property.name: commandLine
c:simple-property.description: the command line of the JVM at the time it was discovered - only used by JVMs with type Local; if the command line of the JVM changes, this property's value will need to be updated accordingly in order for RHQ to connect to the JVM

operation.name: shutdown
operation.description: Shuts down the Cassandra daemon

operation.name: start
operation.description: Starts the Cassandra daemon

operation.name: restart
operation.description: Restarts the Cassandra daemon

operation.name: updateSeedsList
operation.description: Updates the node's seeds property in cassandra.yaml. seedsList must be a list of valid hostnames or IP addresses that are reachable from the agent machine. Note that if hostnames are specified they will be converted to IP addresses so that the seeds property will consist solely of IP addresses.

operation.name: takeSnapshot
operation.description: Takes a snapshot of all keyspaces. A snapshot first flushes all in-memory writes to disk and then creates a hard link of each SSTable file for the keyspace. Note that a column family can have multiple SSTables on disk. By default snapshots are stored in the <cassandra_data_dir>/<keyspace_name>/<column_family_name>/snapshots directory. On Linux/UNIX systems cassandra_data_dir defaults to /var/lib/cassandra/data

c:simple-property.name: snapshotName
c:simple-property.description: Snapshot name. If left empty current system time in milliseconds will be used as the snapshot name.

c:simple-property.name: retentionStrategy
c:simple-property.description: Retention Strategy defines what happens to snapshots after being created. Default is Keep All - nothing is cleaned up, Deletion Strategy is ignored. Keep Last N - newest N snaphosts remain, the rest of snapshots is cleaned up based on Deletion Strategy, N has to be specified using 'count' property. Delete Older Than N days - delete snapshots older than N days, rest of snapshots is cleaned up based on Deletion Strategy, N has to be specified using 'count' property

c:simple-property.name: count
c:simple-property.description: Additional parameter to Retention Strategy, stands for N

c:simple-property.name: deletionStrategy
c:simple-property.description: Deletion Strategy defines what happens to snapshots that don't match Retention Strategy. Default is Delete - snapshots will be deleted. Move - snapshots are moved to location specified by 'location' property.

c:simple-property.name: location
c:simple-property.description: Additional parameter to Deletion Strategy, specifies location to move snaphosts to.

server.name: Cassandra Server JVM
server.description: The JVM of the Cassandra node

c:simple-property.name: type
c:simple-property.description: The EMS connection type for this JVM (cannot be modified)

metric.description: Total number of range operations since execution start
Total number of read operations since execution start
The total latency of all range operations since execution start
The latency all of read operations since execution start
The latency of all write operations since execution start
Total number of write operations since execution start

operation.name: startGossiping
operation.description: Start gossip service

operation.name: stopGossiping
operation.description: Stop gossip service

operation.name: startNativeTransport
operation.description: Start native transport

operation.name: stopNativeTransport
operation.description: Stop native transport

operation.name: startRPCServer
operation.description: Start the Thrift server

operation.name: stopRPCServer
operation.description: Stop the Thrift server

operation.name: decommission
operation.description: Decommission node. WARNING! This will decommission current node! This will stop streams to other nodes and will initiate the process to remove the node from cluster!

operation.name: takeSnapshot
operation.description: Takes a snapshot of all keyspaces. A snapshot first flushes all in-memory writes to disk and then creates a hard link of each SSTable file for each keyspace. Note that a column family can have multiple SSTables on disk. By default snapshots are stored in the [cassandra_data_dir]/[keyspace_name]/[column_family_name]/snapshots directory. On Linux/UNIX systems cassandra_data_dir defaults to /var/lib/cassandra/data

c:simple-property.name: snapshotName
c:simple-property.description: Snapshot name. If left empty current system time in milliseconds will be used as the snapshot name.

operation.name: setLog4jLevel
operation.description: Sets the logging level for classes under the clas qualifier.

metric.description: Percentage of disk space used by Cassandra data files. The aggregate accross all the partitions will be reported if multiple data locations are specified. This is a calculated metric derived from system and Cassandra runtime information.

Percentage of total disk space used. The metric acounts overall disk usage (including system files), not just disk space used by Cassandra. The aggregate accross all the partitions will be reported if multiple data locations are specified. This is a calculated metric derived from system and Cassandra runtime information.

metric.displayName: Free Disk to Data Size Ratio
metric.description: Ratio of (Free Disk)/(Data File Size). A value below 1 is not recommended since a compaction or repair process could double the amount of disk space used by data files. The aggregate accross all the partitions will be reported if multiple data locations are specified. This is a calculated metric derived from system and Cassandra runtime information.
Amount of load in disk usage on the node being queried
Token range ownership (percentual amount of the whole keyspace)

The current schema version for this node. The value is calculated as a checksum of all rows in the system.schema_* column families. This value is used in an algorithm to compare schema versions between nodes and apply updates as necessary. This value should be the same for all fully initialized nodes in the cluster.
Number of tokens belonging to this node

c:simple-property.name: CommitLogLocation
c:simple-property.default: Location of the commit log directory

c:simple-property.name: SavedCachesLocation
c:simple-property.description: Location of the saved caches directory

c:list-property.name: LeavingNodes
c:list-property.description: List of nodes currently leaving the ring.

c:list-property.name: LiveNodes
c:list-property.description: list of live nodes in the cluster, where liveness is determined by the failure detector of the node being queried.

c:list-property.name: JoiningNodes
c:list-property.description: List of nodes currently joining the ring.

c:list-property.name: LoadMap
c:list-property.description: Human-readable load values for the cluster.

c:list-property.name: MovingNodes
c:list-property.description: List of nodes currently moving the ring.

c:list-property.name: Ownership
c:list-property.description: Mapping of token -> percentage of cluster owned by that token

c:list-property.name: UnreachableNodes
c:list-property.description: List of unreachable nodes in the cluster, as determined by this node's failure detector.

metric.description: Size of all commit log segments
Number of tasks waiting to be executed
Number of read timeouts occurred for this node
Number of read unavailable occurred for this node
Number of write timeouts occurred for this node
Number of write unavailables occurred for this node

operation.name: stopCompaction
operation.description: Stop all running compaction-like tasks having the provided type.

metric.description: Number of completed compactions since server [re]start
Maximum number of core compactor threads.
Maximum number of core validator threads.
Number of tasks waiting to be executed
Total number of bytes compacted since server [re]start
Total number of compactions since server [re]start

operation.name: saveCaches
operation.description: Save row and key caches.

operation.name: invalidateKeyCache
operation.description: Invalidate the key cache.

operation.name: invalidateRowCache
operation.description: Invalidate the row cache.

c:simple-property.name: KeyCacheSavePeriodInSeconds
c:simple-property.description: Key cache save period in seconds

c:simple-property.name: RowCacheSavePeriodInSeconds
c:simple-property.description: Row cache save period in seconds

c:simple-property.name: PhiConvictThreshold
c:simple-property.description: Phi-convict threshold sets the sensitivity of the failure detector. Lower values increase the likelihood that an unresponsive node will be marked as down, while higher values decrease the likelihood.

operation.name: getCurrentGenerationNumber
operation.description: Get current generation number

operation.name: getEndpointDowntime
operation.description: Get endpoint downtime

operation.name: unsafeAssassinateEndpoint
operation.description: Unsafe assassinate endpoint

operation.name: repair
operation.description: Cassandra compares data on this node with the versions on other replicas to update any out of sync copies of the data. This should be run infrequently as it is a disk IO and CPU intensive operation. All data for each column that is being repaired is read. Unless you are not performing any deletes, it is important to run regularly scheduled repairs to ensure that deleted data gets purged. The frequency that this should be run should be less than the gc_grace_period for each column family. This runs a repair on all column families in this keyspace.

operation.name: repairPrimaryRange
operation.description: Runs repair over all column families but only for the node's primary range.

operation.name: cleanup
operation.description: Goes through each SSTable file on disk fore each column family and removes keys (i.e., rows) that the node does not own. This should be performed as a routine maintenance task on existing nodes when new nodes are added to the cluster.

operation.name: compact
operation.description: Forces major compaction of the keyspace. Though major compaction can free disk space used during runtime it temporarily doubles disk space usage and is I/O and CPU intensive. Once you run a major compaction, automatic minor compactions are no longer triggered frequently forcing you to manually run major compactions on a routine basis. So while read performance will be good immediately following a major compaction, it will continually degrade until the next major compaction is manually invoked.

operation.name: takeSnapshot
operation.description: Takes a snapshot of this keyspaces. A snapshot first flushes all in-memory writes to disk and then creates a hard link of each SSTable file for the keyspace. Note that a column family can have multiple SSTables on disk. By default snapshots are stored in the <cassandra_data_dir>/<keyspace_name>/<column_family_name>/snapshots directory. On Linux/UNIX systems cassandra_data_dir defaults to /var/lib/cassandra/data

c:simple-property.name: snapshotName
c:simple-property.description: Snapshot name. If left empty current system time in milliseconds will be used as the snapshot name.

operation.name: repair
operation.description: Cassandra compares data on this node with the versions on other replicas to update any out of sync copies of the data. This should be run infrequently as it is a disk IO and CPU intensive operation. All data for each column that is being repaired is read. Unless you are not performing any deletes, it is important to run regularly scheduled repairs to ensure that deleted data gets purged. The frequency that this should be run should be less than the gc_grace_period for the column family.

operation.name: compact
operation.description: Forces major compaction of this column family. Though major compaction can free disk space used during runtime it temporarily doubles disk space usage and is I/O and CPU intensive. Once you run a major compaction, automatic minor compactions are no longer triggered frequently forcing you to manually run major compactions on a routine basis. So while read performance will be good immediately following a major compaction, it will continually degrade until the next major compaction is manually invoked.

operation.name: takeSnapshot
operation.description: Takes a snapshot of this keyspaces. A snapshot first flushes all in-memory writes to disk and then creates a hard link of each SSTable file for the keyspace. Note that a column family can have multiple SSTables on disk. By default snapshots are stored in the <cassandra_data_dir>/<keyspace_name>/<column_family_name>/snapshots directory. On Linux/UNIX systems cassandra_data_dir defaults to /var/lib/cassandra/data

c:simple-property.name: snapshotName
c:simple-property.description: Snapshot name. If left empty current system time in milliseconds will be used as the snapshot name.

operation.name: disableAutoCompaction
operation.description: Disable automatic compaction. Once you disable compaction, automatic minor compactions are no longer triggered frequently forcing you to manually run major compactions on a routine basis.

operation.name: estimateKeys
operation.description: Estimate keys

operation.name: getSSTablesForKey
operation.description: Returns a list of filenames that contain the given key on this node.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Filenames that contain the given key on this node.

operation.name: restoreSnapshot
operation.description: Restore the column family from a previously taken snapshot.

c:simple-property.name: operationResult
c:simple-property.description: Filenames that contain the given key on this node.

metric.description: Disk space used by SSTables belonging to this CF
Number of SSTables on disk for this CF
Size of the largest compacted row
Means size of the compacted rows
Total number of columns present in the memtable.
Total amount of data stored in the memtable, including column related overhead.
Number of times that a flush has resulted in the memtable being switched out.
Size of the smallest compacted row
Estimated number of tasks pending for this column family
Number of read operations since execution start
Latency of read operations since this metric was last sampled
Latency of write operations since this metric was last sampled
Total disk space used by SSTables belonging to this CF, including obsolete ones waiting to be GC'd
Latency of read operations since execution start
Latency of write operations since execution start
Number of SSTables in L0. Always return 0 if Leveled compaction is not enabled.
Number of write operations since execution start

c:simple-property.name: MinimumCompactionThreshold
c:simple-property.description: Minimum number of sstables in queue before compaction kicks off.

c:simple-property.name: MaximumCompactionThreshold
c:simple-property.description: Maximum number of sstables in queue before compaction kicks off.
